title: Court Clerk Engaged To Older Magistrate Dies After Being Hit By Car
text:
Ashleigh Petrie has died after being struck by a car in Victoria's east, weeks after announcing engagement to a magistrate.

Ashleigh Petrie, 23, the court clerk who just announced her engagement to magistrate Rodney Higgins, 68, has died after being hit by a car in Victoria's east.

The relationship between Petrie and Higgins had caused a stir in country Victoria, prompting calls for a judicial review of Higgins' capacity to perform his duties.

Petrie was struck by a car at Metung in East Gippsland in the early hours of Monday morning, and died at the scene.

"Police will prepare a report for the coroner following the death of a 23-year-old woman in Metung on Monday," a police spokeswoman said in a statement.

"It is understood the Mirboo North woman was struck by a vehicle on Metung Road about 1am and the investigation remains ongoing.

"The driver stopped at the scene to assist and was uninjured."

Victorian Chief Magistrate Peter Lauritsen also released a statement on Monday afternoon.

"It is with deep regret that we advise that an employee of the Magistrates Court of Victoria, Ashleigh Petrie, died as a result of an accident involving a motor vehicle early this morning," he said.

"The details are still coming to hand. Our thoughts are with her family, friends and colleagues at this difficult time.

"Judicial officers and staff are being supported, and appropriate counselling and support services are being provided. No further comment will be made at this time."

Latrobe Magistrates Court in Morwell adjourned some cases yesterday to give staff time to deal with the news.

Petrie and Higgins' relationship attracted media attention for their almost 40-year age difference, and last week the shadow attorney-general Edward O'Donohue wrote to the Judicial Commission of Victoria, calling into question Higgins' "capacity to perform his judicial duties".

The couple just announced their engagement last month, with Petrie posting pictures of their holiday in Fiji on Instagram.

"It started with a crush and now I have a ring on my finger," Ms Petrie posted on Instagram.

"The love of my life asked me to marry him and I said YESSSS.

"What an amazing 10 days it has been here in Fiji! I arrived as Rod's girlfriend and I leave as [Rod's] fiance! I cannot wait to become Mrs Higgins."

Mental health professionals are available 24/7 at the beyondblue Support Service – 1300 22 46 36 or via beyondblue.org.au/get-support for online chat (3pm-12am AEST) or email response.
description: Ashleigh Petrie has died after being struck by a car in Victoria's east, weeks after announcing engagement to a magistrate.
